poem:
**Whittling Down**

In stark morning light,   
the whispers converge,   
two figures chiseled   
from the hewn stone of dreams—   
Badenoch and Jenrick.   
Behind, remnants of others,   
pieces scattered, unfinished.   
The air sharp with change,   
questions tracing  
the edges of futures—  
once vibrant, now pared   
to fit a smaller frame,   
doubts echoing   
within silent halls.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thursday briefing: What the shock Badenoch-Jenrick leadership battle says about the future of the Tories Good morning. Well that was unexpected … It took them a full three months, but yesterday, Conservative MPs finally whittled down the candidates to succeed Rishi Sunak to two: Kemi Badenoch and Robert Jenrick. Despite the strong performance of James Cleverly at the party’s conference this month, MPs opted to reject his offer to make them more “normal”, and instead". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
